subject: p19991135
Findings: There is a large amount of air in the right pleural space, despite the presence of two chest tubes. ET tube tip is in standard position, 6 cm above the carina. Cardiac size is normal. Widened mediastinum can be post-operative. Patient has severe emphysema. Left lower lobe opacities could represent mild interstitial edema. The remaining right lung is partially collapsed. Surgical clips project in the right hilum, and mid lung.
